author: jsoref
body:
While these changes technically impact the build, they should be debug only changes that only impact debugging failure cases. There are also only a handful of them which should make review easy.

These can definitely be squashed together. I'm slowly peeling them out from other categories...

The ErrorRecord commit might need to be dropped. Essentially that's changing an "Error ID" which might be considered a public API (I don't know).

comments.author: msftclas
comments.body:
Hi **@jsoref**, I'm your friendly neighborhood Microsoft Pull Request Bot (You can call me MSBOT). Thanks for your contribution! You've already signed the contribution license agreement. Thanks!

The agreement was validated by Microsoft and real humans are currently evaluating your PR.

TTYL, MSBOT;

comments.author: jsoref
comments.body:
The log:

```

List of reference assemblies written to ../TypeCatalogGen/powershell.inc
piled because expected outputs are missing
Compiling TypeCatalogGen for .NETCoreApp,Version=v1.0
Compilation succeeded.
    0 Warning(s)
    0 Error(s)
Time elapsed 00:00:01.6198325

Unhandled Exception: System.IO.InvalidDataException: Reference assembly '/home/travis/.nuget/packages/Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Common/1.1.1/lib/portable-net45+win8/Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.dll' is declared in the reference list file '/home/travis/build/PowerShell/PowerShell/src/TypeCatalogGen/powershell.inc', but the assembly doesn't exist.
   at Microsoft.PowerShell.CoreCLR.TypeCatalogGen.ResolveReferenceAssemblies(String path)
   at Microsoft.PowerShell.CoreCLR.TypeCatalogGen.Main(String[] args)
Run dotnet publish --configuration Linux --framework netcoreapp1.0 --runtime ubuntu.14.04-x64 from /home/travis/build/PowerShell/PowerShell/src/powershell-unix
Publishing powershell for .NETCoreApp,Version=v1.0/ubuntu.14.04-x64
Project Microsoft.PowerShell.CoreCLR.AssemblyLoadContext (.NETStandard,Version=v1.6) will be compiled because expected outputs are missing
Compiling Microsoft.PowerShell.CoreCLR.AssemblyLoadContext for .NETStandard,Version=v1.6
/home/travis/.dotnet/dotnet compile-csc @/home/travis/build/PowerShell/PowerShell/src/Microsoft.PowerShell.CoreCLR.AssemblyLoadContext/obj/Linux/netstandard1.6/dotnet-compile.rsp returned Exit Code 1
/home/travis/build/PowerShell/PowerShell/src/Microsoft.PowerShell.CoreCLR.AssemblyLoadContext/CoreCLR/CorePsAssemblyLoadContext.cs(112,35): error CS0103: The name 'InitializeTypeCatalog' does not exist in the current context
```

I don't understand the error:

```
 error CS0103: The name 'InitializeTypeCatalog' does not exist in the current context
```

Offhand, it sounds like the class is not well connected to the base-like class...
src/TypeCatalogGen/TypeCatalogGen.cs:
System.Management.Automation
    internal partial class PowerShellAssemblyLoadContext
        private Dictionary<string, string> InitializeTypeCatalog()

But I don't think I've changed either src/TypeCatalogGen/TypeCatalogGen.cs or src/Microsoft.PowerShell.CoreCLR.AssemblyLoadContext/CoreCLR/CorePsAssemblyLoadContext.cs,
nor src/Microsoft.PowerShell.CoreCLR.AssemblyLoadContext/map.json the file that references it...

I can submitting fewer commits and seeing if the problem goes away. But for such a small PR this is pretty baffling.

comments.author: jsoref
comments.body: @vors: I've removed the two additional commits (they're temporarily living in https://github.com/jsoref/PowerShell/tree/spelling-debug-2 ), and the builders are happy. Once this is in, I'll see about asking the builders about those commits...

comments.author: vors
comments.body:
This error is unrelated. It was caused by changes in `dotnet` cli.
See https://twitter.com/xvorsx/status/771490623174037504 for details.

comments.author: vors
comments.body:
@jsoref per discussion above, we don't need to change the "Transcripting" case. The `InvalidCharactersInPath` belongs to over "FullyQuilifiedErrorId" misspellings. Hence, I'm going to close the PR.

Looking forward for other spelling PRs!

title: Spelling debug
